chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
q: nat
p: nat
n: nat

Goal:
p <= q -> power n p <= power n q

Premises:
Notation power := (mscal Init.Nat.mul 1)
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
power_mono : forall p q x : nat, 1 <= x -> p <= q -> power p x <= power q x
power_mono_l : forall p q x : nat, 1 <= x -> p <= q -> power p x <= power q x
power_smono_l : forall p q x : nat, 2 <= x -> p < q -> power p x < power q x
power_sinc : forall k p : nat, 2 <= p -> power k p < power (S k) p
mult_le_compat : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p <= q -> n * p <= m * q
Nat.add_le_mono : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p <= q -> n + p <= m + q
plus_le_compat : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p <= q -> n + p <= m + q
power_ge_n : forall k p : nat, 2 <= p -> k <= power k p
Nat.mul_lt_mono_nonneg : forall n m p q : nat, 0 <= n -> n < m -> 0 <= p -> p < q -> n * p < m * q
gcd.bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> gcd.is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}
power_ge_1 : forall k p : nat, p <> 0 -> 1 <= power k p
gcd.is_gcd_modulus : forall p q k r : nat, gcd.divides p k -> k <= q -> gcd.is_gcd p q r -> gcd.is_gcd p (q - k) r
power_plus : forall p a b : nat, power (a + b) p = power a p * power b p
gcd.is_gcd_div : forall p q : nat, gcd.divides p q -> gcd.is_gcd p q p
gcd.is_gcd_sym : forall p q r : nat, gcd.is_gcd p q r -> gcd.is_gcd q p r
gcd.is_lcm_sym : forall p q r : nat, gcd.is_lcm p q r -> gcd.is_lcm q p r
gcd.is_gcd_fun : forall p q r1 r2 : nat, gcd.is_gcd p q r1 -> gcd.is_gcd p q r2 -> r1 = r2
Nat.add_lt_mono : forall n m p q : nat, n < m -> p < q -> n + p < m + q
gcd.is_gcd_0 : forall p q : nat, gcd.is_gcd p q 0 -> p = 0 /\ q = 0
gcd.bezout_generalized_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> {a : nat & {b : nat & {g : nat & {l : nat & {u : nat & {v : nat | a * p + b * q = g + l /\ gcd.is_gcd p q g /\ gcd.is_lcm p q l /\ p = u * g /\ q = v * g /\ a <= v /\ b <= u}}}}}}
gcd.div_rem_spec2 : forall q p : nat, p <> 0 -> gcd.rem q p < p
power_mult : forall p a b : nat, power (a * b) p = power a (power b p)
gcd.divides_mult : forall p q k : nat, gcd.divides p q -> gcd.divides p (k * q)
gcd.is_gcd_moduplus : forall p q k r : nat, gcd.divides p k -> gcd.is_gcd p q r -> gcd.is_gcd p (q + k) r
gcd.div_rem_spec1 : forall q p : nat, q = gcd.div q p * p + gcd.rem q p
gcd.is_lcm_moduplus : forall k p q g l u : nat, p = u * g -> gcd.is_gcd p q g -> gcd.is_lcm p q l -> gcd.is_lcm p (q + k * p) (l + k * u * p)
gcd.bezout_rel_prime : forall p q : nat, gcd.is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q}}
gcd.is_lcm = fun p q r : nat => gcd.divides p r /\ gcd.divides q r /\ (forall k : nat, gcd.divides p k -> gcd.divides q k -> gcd.divides r k) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gcd.is_lcm (_ _ _)%nat_scope
gcd.is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => gcd.divides r p /\ gcd.divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, gcd.divides k p -> gcd.divides k q -> gcd.divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gcd.is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
gcd.div = fun q p : nat => projT1 (gcd.div_full q p) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments gcd.div (_ _)%nat_scope
gcd.rem = fun q p : nat => proj1_sig (projT2 (gcd.div_full q p)) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments gcd.rem (_ _)%nat_scope
gcd.arem = fun n d q j : nat => j <= d /\ (n = 2 * q * d + j \/ q <> 0 /\ n = 2 * q * d - j) : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gcd.arem (_ _ _ _)%nat_scope
Nat.le_trans : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> m <= p -> n <= p
Nat.mul_le_mono_nonneg_r : forall n m p : nat, 0 <= p -> n <= m -> n * p <= m * p
Nat.mul_le_mono_nonneg_l : forall n m p : nat, 0 <= p -> n <= m -> p * n <= p * m
power_S : forall n x : nat, power (S n) x = x * power n x
gcd.div_ge_1 : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall n : nat, p <= n -> 1 <= gcd.div n p
power_of_0 : forall n : nat, 0 < n -> power n 0 = 0
Nat.lt_le_trans : forall n m p : nat, n < m -> m <= p -> n < p
Nat.le_lt_trans : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> m < p -> n < p

``` 
intros q p n H.
apply Nat.le_trans with (m := power n p).
- apply power_mono; auto.
- apply power_mono; auto.
```
